Search Results for

    Show / Hide Table of Contents

    Class EventAggregator

    Allows listening to events without introducing direct coupling between observer and observable. The observer can handle events withou introducing a dependency to the event source.

    Inheritance
    System.Object
    EventAggregator
    Implements
    IEventAggregator
    Inherited Members

    System.Object.ToString()

    Registers a handler for any registered event source with a compatible event delegate signature.

    Returns
    Type Description
    System.Boolean

    true when registration was successful, otherwise false.

    Registers a handler for any registered event source with a compatible event delegate signature.

    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    System.Delegate eventHandler

    A delegate that handles the specified event.
    System.Boolean isMarshalEventToCurrentThreadEnabled

    true if the current System.Threading.SynchronizationContext should be captured to execute the event handler.

    true when registration was successful, otherwise false.

    TryRemoveObservable(Object, IEnumerable<String>, Boolean)

    Unregister the event publisher for a collection of specified events.

    Declaration
    public bool TryRemoveObservable(object eventSource, IEnumerable<string> eventNames, bool removeEventObservers = false)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    System.Object eventSource

    The event publisher instance.
    System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.String> eventNames

    The names of the events to unregister.
    System.Boolean removeEventObservers

    If true removes all event listeners of the specified events. The value is false by default.
    Returns
    Type Description
    System.Boolean

    true when removal was successful, otherwise false.
    | Improve this Doc View Source
